intro: Xanthoxalis rosea, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shady areas and has alternate, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Xanthoxalis rosea is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation.
